articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor b6th in G# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio - Minor b6th in G# (Shape: C)

## Description
An arpeggio is the notes of a chord played one after the other instead of simultaneously. In this case, the arpeggio is the Minor b6th in G#, derived from the C major scale. 

## Notes and Intervals
The arpeggio consists of the following notes relative to the root note G# (or Ab):
- G# (Root)
- B (Major 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F# (Minor 7th)
- A (Minor 6th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio has a dark and mysterious quality due to the minor 6th interval. It adds tension and color to the musical phrase. This arpeggio is commonly used in genres such as jazz, neo-soul, and progressive rock to create a moody and sophisticated sound.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor b6th in G# arpeggio:
1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "Right Place Wrong Time" by Dr. John
3. "7" by Prince
